definitions.definition: The act of turning around a centre or an axis.
definitions.example: The earth's rotation about its axis is responsible for its being slightly oblate rather than a sphere.

definitions.definition: A single complete cycle around a centre or an axis.
definitions.example: Earth's moon completes a rotation every twenty-seven days or so.

definitions.definition: A regular variation in a sequence, such as to even-out wear, or people taking turns in a task; a duty roster.
definitions.example: In rotation, each member of the group would be responsible for the beacon fire.

definitions.definition: An operation on a metric space that is a continuous isometry and fixes at least one point.
definitions.example: The function mapping (x,y) to (−y,x) is a rotation.

definitions.definition: The set of starting pitchers of a team.
The step during takeoff when the pilot commands the vehicle to lift the nose wheel off the ground during the takeoff roll. (see also: V2)
Repeated play on a radio station, etc.
definitions.example: The new single enjoyed heavy rotation on MTV.
